snippet: The College of Arms has ruled that married same-sex couples in Britain may combine their heraldic symbols on one shield as generations of heterosexual aristocracy have done.
abstract: College of Arms, guardian of noble titles and insignia in Great Britain, issues ruling that married same-sex couples may combine their heraldic symbols on a single shield as generations of heterosexual aristocracy have done before them.
lead_paragraph: The College of Arms has ruled that married same-sex couples in Britain may combine their heraldic symbols on one shield as generations of heterosexual aristocracy have done.

headline.main: Step Forward Into Past for British Gay Couples: Coats of Arms
headline.print_headline: Step Forward Into Past for British Gay Couples: Coats of Arms

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
